To sustain all of our global needs - fruits and vegetables available even if out of season, massive land allocated to produce meat, energy, clothing, construction materials, travel and leisure, technology and research. Most of these needs are sourced out to businesses that operate for a profit - hence. More consumption, more profit, more products, better services - the cycle repeats itself over and over.

I find this very alarming due to the amount of resources needed to sustain our wants and needs. I was watching a short video done by Climate lab and Vox on food wastage. We are approximately 7.7 billion already, growing at a pace of 1.07% per year. It is catastrophic if all humans on earth would try to live like a westerner. Experts thinks that we need four earths to accomodate the natural resources needed.
